statement.para: The vector \Vect{x} = (3,-1) is represented by any of the arrows in the picture below.

answer.para: Indeed, consider any of these arrows. Starting from its tail, we find its tip by

li.para: moving 3 units in the first coordinate direction, and
from there moving -1 unit in the second coordinate direction.
R(2,2) as the tail point of an arrow representing \Vect{x}, the tip of this arrow will be at S(2+3,2+(-1))=S(5,1)
A(14,-6) as the tail point of an arrow representing \Vect{x}, the tip of this arrow will be at B(17,-7)
U(0,0) as the tail point of an arrow representing \Vect{x}, the tip of this arrow will be at V(3,-1)
